Per the 2019 FDA guidance on adaptive designs for clinical trials of drugs and biologics, an adaptive design is defined as <em>"a clinical trial design that allows for prospectively planned modifications to one or more aspects of the design based on accumulating data from subjects in the trial"</em>.

Adaptive designs require to put in place statistical and operational safeguards in order to maintain the validity and the integrity of the trial.
